means: Gone With The Wind <飘>（小说名）

sentence.Network_en: The opportunity had gone. His mind scrabbled for alternatives.
sentence.Network_cn: 机会已经失去。他苦苦思索别的方案。

sentence.Network_en: It was just gone 7 o'clock this evening when I finished.
sentence.Network_cn: 今晚我做完的时候刚过7点。

sentence.Network_en: Four of them had gone off to find help.
sentence.Network_cn: 他们中的4个人去寻求帮助了。

when heaven cries and you are gone ., 当天空哭泣 , 而你已远去.

lj.lj_ly: I always knew he was awfully gone on you.
lj.lj_ls: 我一直知道他深深地迷恋着你。

jx.jx_en_mean: a huntsman's cry, indicating that a fox has been started
jx.jx_cn_mean: 跑了！（猎人的叫喊声，表示狐狸已被惊出洞穴）

entry.def: Gone is the past participle of go .

entry.tran: 离开的；过去的；不复存在的
entry.def: When someone is gone, they have left the place where you are and are no longer there. When something is gone, it  is no longer present or no longer exists.

example.ex: While he was gone she had tea with the Colonel...
example.tran: 他不在时她跟上校一起喝了茶。

example.ex: He's already been gone four hours!...

entry.def: If you say it is gone a particular time, you mean it is later than that time.

example.ex: It was just gone 7 o'clock this evening when I finished.
example.tran: 今晚我做完的时候刚过7点。

sentences.sentence: "you must not allow a stranger into the house when your mother is away"

Sentence.sentence: Large numbers of builders, property firms and retailers have gone bankrupt.

As our special report in this issue (printed before Mr Jobs's death) explains, innovation used to spill over from military and corporate laboratories to the consumer market, but lately this process has gone into reverse.
He has gone through a similar experience.
Sweden has gone farther than any other nation on earth to integrate the sexes and to offer women the same opportunities and freedoms as men.
But he hasn't gone through a single meeting, has he?
Thus traumatized (受到创伤) the economy might have gone into a free fall ending in depression

sentences.en: Two days later he was gone.
